jam.sort.stream
Class EventInputStream

java.lang.Object
  jam.sort.stream.EventInputStream
Direct Known Subclasses:
Kmax6InputStream, L002HeaderReader, L003InputStream, UconnInputStream, XsysInputStream
public abstract class EventInputStream
extends java.lang.Object

A general-purpose InputStream of experiment events that can be sorted.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 August 98
Author:
Ken Swartz

read

public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
Reads a byte. Only implemented as a requirement of extending InputStream, which defines this method abstract.

Returns:
the next byte in the stream defined in setInputStream()
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if ther's a problem reading from the stream
See Also:
setInputStream(java.io.InputStream)

readDataWord

public short readDataWord()
                   throws java.io.IOException
Reads the next data word as a short. Can be overidden by subclasses.

Returns:
a short read from the input stream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if ther's a problem reading from the stream
See Also:
setInputStream(java.io.InputStream)

loadRunInfo

public void loadRunInfo()
Loads the run information, usually after it is read from a header.

readEvent

public abstract EventInputStatus readEvent(int[] event)
                                    throws EventException
Reads an event into the passed array and returns a status flag. This can take on the following values
  • EVENT
  • END_RUN
  • END_BUFFER
  • ERROR

Parameters:
event - container for the event info read from the event stream
Returns:
an indicator of the status after the read from the event stream
Throws:
EventException - thrown if an error condition cannot be handled
See Also:
EventInputStatus

readHeader

public abstract boolean readHeader()
                            throws EventException
Reads a header and return a status flag.

Returns:
true if OK, false if there was a problem
Throws:
EventException - thrown if an error condition cannot be handled

isEndRun

public abstract boolean isEndRun(short word)
Checks if a word is an end-of-run marker.

Parameters:
word - to be checked whether it is an end-of-run marker
Returns:
true if yes, false if no
Throws:
EventException - thrown if an error condition cannot be handled
